meanings.definition: Not solid; lacking a definite shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The jelly was nonsolid and wobbled when touched.
meanings.sent2: The cloud was nonsolid, constantly changing its shape.
meanings.sent3: The nonsolid pudding seemed to dance on the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were nonsolid, drifting like smoke in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The nonsolid mist enveloped the forest, hiding everything within.

meanings.definition: Not firm or stable; easily changed or influenced.
meanings.sent1: His nonsolid promises were easily forgotten.
meanings.sent2: The sandcastle was nonsolid, crumbling at the slightest touch.
meanings.sent3: The nonsolid argument fell apart under scrutiny.
meanings.sent4: Her nonsolid loyalty shifted with the wind.
meanings.sent5: The nonsolid ground beneath her feet felt like walking on air.
